subject: Investing
title: When to Revisit Your Risk Plan
description: A micro-lesson that makes When to Revisit Your Risk Plan usable.

hook.text: A single 30-year-old invested aggressively. Ten years later, married with kids, she still had the same allocation.

buildup.text: Life eventsâ€”marriage, children, job change, inheritanceâ€”shift both your risk capacity and tolerance.

discovery.text: A good rule: revisit your investment plan at every major life milestone and at least once a year.

twist.text: Market events should not trigger plan changes. Life events should. That distinction is everything.

climax.text: Adjusting your plan to match your actual life keeps risk aligned with what matters most to you.

punchline.text: Your portfolio should grow up as fast as you do.

quiz.question: What should trigger a risk plan review?
options: Major life events and annual check-ins
